item.title: Discoloured (?polluted) water still after a year pouring into lane, 28th March
item.description:
About a hundred yards from the Little Shurdington end of Dark Lane, Bentham - from the east bank. This is not a new occurrence, but was originally reported (Enquiry 11457212) nearly a year ago and was then said to be under investigation. It has continued ever since, regardless of weather conditions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dark Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Cycle path tyre popping surface debris all along route, 28th March
item.description:
All the way along the cycle path from Churchdown to Cheltenham. Various broken glass, mud, blocked drains. The bit opposite the briarfields hotel routinely floods deeply across the entire width of the cyclepath/pavement. Be great if you could routinely sweep and clean it before people decide itâ€™s safer and less expensive on inner tubes to use the road!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
